item.title: Half of Assassin’s Creed Shadows Devs Have Never Built A Game Before
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/half-of-assassins-creed-shadows-devs-have-never-built-a-game-before/

We’ve witnessed a whole lot of turmoil surrounding the development of Assassin’s Creed Shadows, with delays and controversy marring the title before its release. Well, as it turns out, there may be a reason why the upcoming AC game is so controversial. It appears Assassin’s Creed Shadows is going to be the first game for a number of game developers at Ubisoft. While it’s common practice to bring in new talent regularly and keep the old-timers on their toes, it would seem much of the team behind Shadows is completely green behind the ears.

In an appearance at the External Development Summit 2024 (XDS24), Assassin’s Creed Executive Producer Marc-Alexis Côté said:

One of the things that I’ve noticed since the pandemic is that we have a lot of juniors in our teams. Probably half the team that’s building Assassin’s Creed is building a game for the first time.

While the video below is set to begin approximately where Marc-Alexis Côté spoke about the game’s development, you can watch the full keynote from XDS24 here:

Unfortunately, the sour news doesn’t stop there. According to Marc-Alexis Côté, the game’s internal evaluation isn’t promising, either. The team behind Shadows considers this entry to be the weakest in the entire Assassin’s Creed franchise, which speaks volumes about Ubisoft’s development overall.

When Assassin’s Creed Shadows finally launches in 2025, it might do so to lackluster reviews and poor critical reception. For now, only time will tell!

What do you think of Assassin’s Creed Shadows? Is it destined to be a flop before it ever releases? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below, and don’t forget to go vote for Game of the Year on the Insider Gaming community forum!

We’ve heard quite a bit about the upcoming AC game to date, but it appears the boss behind the scenes also talked about the Assassin’s Creed Shadows delay!

item.title: Terminally Ill Fan Played Borderlands 4 And Said “It Was Amazing”
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/terminally-ill-fan-played-borderlands-4-and-said-it-was-amazing/

A terminally ill fan of the Borderlands series was given the opportunity to play Borderlands 4 after his plea reached developer Gearbox.

Caleb McAlpine, a Borderlands fan with Stage 4 terminal cancer, was flown out with a friend to Gearbox Software in order to experience the upcoming game. In a post on Reddit, McAlpine spoke about his experience at the studio.

After meeting the developers and CEO Randy Pitchford to playing an early build of Borderlands 4, he wanted to express his thanks to everyone who helped make this dream a reality.

“We got to play what they have for Borderlands 4 so far and it was amazing,” McAlpine said. “I don’t know if I will be around when the game Comes out but I just want to say thank you to all of you for all of your love and support and for helping in making this happen. It truly was an amazing experience and it was just awesome.

Borderlands 4 is scheduled to launch sometime in 2025 for Xbox Series X|S, PlayStation 5, and PC. More details about the game will be announced at a later date.

McApline’s latest prognosis as of October was that he had less than two years if chemotherapy slowed the progression of the cancer.

We wish Caleb all the best in his current fight.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the plans for Baldur’s Gate 3 Patch 8 coming next year. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Up Your Game in Black Ops 6 Ransack Mode With IG’s Tips and Tricks
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/black-ops-6-ransack-mode-tips/

Are you struggling with Call of Duty: Black Ops 6’s new game mode, Ransack? Insider Gaming has a few tips and tricks to help you survive and excel in the new mode, score gold, help your team score big, and rank up in the process!

What is Ransack?

Ransack is the newest game mode added to Black Ops 6 in November 2024. It is a 6v6 mode where you loot gold bars from stashes around the map. One stash will open at a time; you gather the gold from it and bring it back to your team’s safe. You can also take gold off of enemies you down and steal from the enemy safe! Whichever team reaches the gold cap first or whoever has the most gold at the end of the round when the timer goes off wins.

How to Succeed at Ransack

Working with your teammates is critical in this mode. Each team must guard their safe, loot and steal gold from the other team, and watch their backs. Loadouts, scorestreaks, and equipment must be chosen carefully to maximize success. You should play your most comfortable loadout to play your best for your team; solo play is a detriment to your entire team.

Many players recommend varying your “tasks” in this game mode. You don’t want to always be on the attack or always on the defense. Changing your strategy to switch between looting, killing, and defending is essential.

Suggested Loadouts, Scorestreaks, and Equipment for Ransack

As for loadouts, it’s once again worth mentioning that you should play how you’re most comfortable. If you’re great with an LMG or a shotgun, go for it. Just make sure your team is balanced between long-, mid-, and short-range weapons.

Scorestreaks are important in all modes of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, but for Ransack, they’re particularly essential. Some recommended scorestreaks are:

  • Scout Pulse so that you can see enemies around you.
  • UAV so that you can see enemies all around the map.
  • Counter UAV so that enemies can’t see you on the map.

For equipment, go big or go home!

  • Lethal Equipment
    • Sticky Grenade
    • Frag Grenade
  • Tactical Equipment
    • Concussion Grenade
    • Flashbang Grenade
    • Smoke Grenade
    • Shock Charges
  • Field Upgrades
    • Assault Pack
    • War Cry
    • Spring Mine
    • Trophy System

However you decide to play Ransack, know that it’s an entertaining mode. It’s one of my favorites to play while unwinding after a long day. Let us know in the comments how much you like (or dislike) this mode!

Do you have any additional tips to add for Ransack? Let us know in the comments below, or start a thread in the community forum!

Speaking of tips, here’s one for you: Don’t forget to score some awesome Monster energy drink rewards for Call of Duty before the event ends!

item.title: Shop at Target for Gaming Black Friday Deals This Year
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/shop-at-target-for-gaming-black-friday-deals-this-year/

Take advantage of Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals at Target to get gifts for yourself, a particular gamer in your life, or a tech enthusiast you love. You can score copies of your favorite games, a brand-new VR headset, or even an entirely new console to treat yourself or a loved one this season. Don’t miss out on these extravagant deals!

Deals on Consoles, Games, and Accessories!

Are you or someone you know passionate about video games and tech? Look no further—Target has got you covered! Be sure to check the Target deals page often in case prices fluctuate.

Console Deals

  • PlayStation 5 Digital Editon Console (Slim) ($374.99)
  • Xbox Series S (512GB) ($249.00)
  • Nintendo Switch Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle ($224.99)

VR/AR Accessories

  • PlayStation VR2 Core ($349.99)
  • Meta Quest 3S All-in-One-Headset 128GB (With Batman: Arkham Shadow & 3-Month Trial of Meta Quest+) ($299.99)
  • Ray-Ban | Meta Wayfarer Smart Glasses – Matte Black Frames, Polarized Gray Lenses ($263.20)

Video Game Deals

  • NBA 2K25 for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X ($29.99)
  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons for Nintendo Switch ($34.99)
  • EA SPORTS Madden 25 for PlayStation 5 ($34.99)
  • Super Mario Odyssey (Physical) for Nintendo Switch ($29.99)
  • Bluey: The Videogame (Physical) for Nintendo Switch ($19.99)
  • Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury for Nintendo Switch ($34.99)
  • Astro Bot for PlayStation 5 ($49.99)
  • Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 Standard Edition for PlayStation 5 ($39.99)
  • EA SPORTS FC 25 for Xbox Series X and Xbox One ($34.99)
  • The Last of Us Part 1 for PlayStation 5 ($29.99)

Accessory & Peripheral Deals

  • Xbox Series X|S Wireless Controller in Black, White, Blue, Red, Electric Volt, or Deep Pink ($39.99-$44.99 each)
  • DualSense Wireless Controller for PlayStation 5 in Midnight Black, Cosmic Red, White/Black, Starlight Blue, Nova Pink, Galactic Purple, Gray, Black/Red, Cobalt Blue, Volcanic Red, Sterling Silver, Astro Bot, Chroma Indigo, Chroma Pearl, 30th Anniversary Gray, Fortnite, or Chroma Teal ($54.99-$84.99 each)
  • Nintendo Switch Joy-Con in Red/Blue, Purple/Orange, Blue/Yellow, Pink/Green, or Gray ($59.99-$79.99 each)
  • Razer Huntsman Mini Gaming Keyboard for PC in Black ($69.99)
  • Nintendo Switch Game Traveler Deluxe Travel Case in Light Gray ($14.99)
  • Logitech G733 Wireless Gaming Headset in Black ($109.99)

Prices may vary during the Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales, so check the deal page often! Some video game deals are also only for the physical version of the game (which is listed when applicable).

Once you score a few gaming deals at Target, let us know what you picked up in the comments. Or, visit the official Insider Gaming community forum to see recommendations and discuss the latest releases!

Speaking of shockingly low Black Friday gaming deals, don’t forget to check Amazon for huge savings this year on your favorite titles, peripherals, and even computer parts!

item.title: 11 bit studios Unveils Frostpunk 2 Roadmap for 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/11-bit-studios-unveils-frostpunk-2-roadmap-for-2025/

Here at Insider Gaming, we spent a lot of time surviving the world of Frostpunk 2 on release, with countless guides under our belt to help newcomers and returning players survive the frozen wasteland. Well, it appears we’re not entirely done with the post-apocalypse. Today, developer 11 bit studios announced its Frostpunk 2 roadmap for 2025, featuring its plans for additional content and improvements in the coming year.

Since its launch in September, Frostpunk 2 has been ‘Mostly Positive’ on Steam, with nearly 1,000 players in-game at the time of this writing, which is, surprisingly enough, in the middle of the work day. At launch, the survival city-building game hit a peak player count of over 35,000 at one point!

Here’s what we have to look forward to from Frostpunk 2 in 2025:

  • Major Content Updates: At least one major content update is currently planned for 2025, with quality-of-life improvements, bug fixes, and new game content and mechanics added based on player feedback.
  • Console Launch: Frostpunk 2 will officially launch on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S in 2025, though the studio has not released an official date.
  • DLC: Three major DLC packs will launch throughout the year to Frostpunk 2 in 2025—Spectrum, Aurora, and a currently unnamed DLC pack. These DLC packs will include additional story elements, new mechanics, and so much more to expand the unforgiving world of Frostpunk 2!

If you’ve yet to play Frostpunk 2, it’s available now on PC Game Pass!

What did you think of Frostpunk 2? Let us know in the comments below, or visit the official community forums to discuss this and other strategy games you enjoy!

No matter when you dive into Frostpunk 2, you’ll need to learn how to build a Research Institute if you wish to survive the frozen apocalypse in the long term!
